text:
One final note. We described how to go from one comer to a better neighbor. 
We did not describe bow to find the first comer-which is easy in this example but 
nOI always. One way is to create new variables X5 and X6, which begin at 4 and 2 
(with all the original x's at zero). Then start the simple)!: method with X5 + X6 as the 
cost. Switch to the original problem after xs and X6 reach zero-a starting comer for 
the original problem has been found 
Problem Set 8.4
